summary: This document is an email chain from August 10, 2019, discussing the aftermath of Jeffrey Epstein's death. It includes a request from Epstein's counsel to delay his autopsy to allow a pathologist to be present, and coordination among legal and prosecutorial staff regarding the investigation.

persons.name: Miller, Michael
persons.context: Requests to delay Jeffrey Epstein's autopsy to arrange for a pathologist to be present.

persons.name: Martin G. Weinberg
persons.context: Listed as a recipient/copied on the email regarding Epstein's autopsy and investigation.

persons.name: Weingarten, Reid
persons.context: Listed as a recipient/copied on the email regarding Epstein's autopsy and investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased individual whose autopsy is being discussed; the subject of the criminal case US v Epstein.

connections.description: Miller is acting as legal counsel for Jeffrey Epstein, making requests regarding his autopsy.
Weinberg is copied on legal correspondence regarding Epstein's case and death investigation.
Weingarten is copied on legal correspondence regarding Epstein's case and death investigation.
Both are attorneys copied on the same email chain regarding Epstein's legal matters.

events.title: Epstein's death and autopsy planning
events.description: Following Jeffrey Epstein's death, his counsel requests to delay the autopsy to arrange for a private pathologist to be present.

events.title: Scheduled autopsy
events.description: Epstein's autopsy is reportedly scheduled for the morning of August 11, 2019, prompting the defense's request for a delay.

events.title: Investigation initiation
events.description: Legal and prosecutorial staff coordinate the initiation of an investigation into how Jeffrey Epstein died.

keyFacts: Epstein's defense counsel requested a delay of his autopsy from August 11 to August 13, 2019, to arrange for a private pathologist to be present.
The email chain indicates coordination between Epstein's legal team and prosecutorial offices regarding the investigation into his death.
The correspondence shows immediate legal and procedural activity following Epstein's death in custody.
